blocks.name: cuni
blocks.content: Extend class notation to include the union of a class. Read: "union (of) ` A ` ".
blocks.origin: prop class cuni(class c0) { ‚ãÉ c0 }

blocks.name: diff.cuni.s
diff.cuni.c
diff.cuni.w
df-uni
blocks.content: Define the union of a class i.e. the collection of all members of the members of the class. Definition 5.5 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 16. For example, ` U. { { 1 , 3 } , { 1 , 8 } } = { 1 , 3 , 8 } ` ( ~ ex-uni ). This is similar to the union of two classes ~ df-un . (Contributed by NM, 23-Aug-1993.)

blocks.name: eluni
blocks.content: Membership in class union. (Contributed by NM, 22-May-1994.)
blocks.origin:
thm eluni(setvar s0, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wb(wcel(c0, cuni(c1)), wex(s0, wa(wcel(c0, cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s0), c1))))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
} = {
  pm5.21nii(wcel(c0, cuni(c1)), wex(s0, wa(wcel(c0, cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s0), c1))), wcel(c0, universe))
  elex(c0, cuni(c1))
  exlimiv(s0, wa(wcel(c0, cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s0), c1)), wcel(c0, universe))
  adantr(wcel(c0, cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s0), c1), wcel(c0, universe))
  elex(c0, cv(s0))
  elab2g(hs0, c0, universe, cuni(c1), wex(s0, wa(wcel(c0, cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s0), c1))), wex(s0, wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s0), c1))))
  exbidv(s0, wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s0), c1)), wa(wcel(c0, cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s0), c1)))
  anbi1d(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s0), c1), wcel(c0, cv(s0)))
  eleq1(cv(hs0), c0, cv(s0))
  df-uni(hs0, s0, c1)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c0, universe)
  diff.universe.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w(wex(s0, wa(wcel(c0, cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s0), c1))))
  diff.wceq.s(s0, cv(hs0), c0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
}

thm eluni(setvar s0, class c0, class c1) {
  ‚ä¢ (c0 ‚àà ‚ãÉ c1 ‚Üî ‚àÉ(s0,(c0 ‚àà s0 ‚àß s0 ‚àà c1)))

  pm5.21nii(c0 ‚àà ‚ãÉ c1, ‚àÉ(s0,(c0 ‚àà s0 ‚àß s0 ‚àà c1)), c0 ‚àà ùïå)
  elex(c0, ‚ãÉ c1)

  adantr(c0 ‚àà s0, s0 ‚àà c1, c0 ‚àà ùïå)
  elex(c0, s0)
  elab2g(hs0, c0, universe, ‚ãÉ c1, ‚àÉ(s0,(c0 ‚àà s0 ‚àß s0 ‚àà c1)), ‚àÉ(s0,(hs0 ‚àà s0 ‚àß s0 ‚àà c1)))
  exbidv(s0, hs0 = c0, (hs0 ‚àà s0 ‚àß s0 ‚àà c1), (c0 ‚àà s0 ‚àß s0 ‚àà c1))
  anbi1d(hs0 = c0, hs0 ‚àà s0, s0 ‚àà c1, c0 ‚àà s0)
  eleq1(hs0, c0, s0)
  df-uni(hs0, s0, c1)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c0, universe)
  diff.universe.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w(‚àÉ(s0,(c0 ‚àà s0 ‚àß s0 ‚àà c1)))
  diff.wceq.s(s0, hs0, c0)

} = {
  sylibr(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c1, c2)), wcel(c0, cuni(c2)), wex(hs0, wa(wcel(c0, cv(hs0)), wcel(cv(hs0), c2))))
  anabsi7(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c1, c2), wex(hs0, wa(wcel(c0, cv(hs0)), wcel(cv(hs0), c2))))
  spcegv(hs0, c1, c2, wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c1, c2)), wa(wcel(c0, cv(hs0)), wcel(cv(hs0), c2)))
  anbi12d(wceq(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(c0, cv(hs0)), wcel(cv(hs0), c2), wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c1, c2))
  eleq2(cv(hs0), c1, c0)
  eleq1(cv(hs0), c1, c2)
  eluni(hs0, c0, c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.w(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c1, c2)))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
}

blocks.name: unieq
blocks.content: Equality theorem for class union. Exercise 15 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 18. (Contributed by NM, 10-Aug-1993.) (Proof shortened by Andrew Salmon, 29-Jun-2011.)
blocks.origin:
thm unieq(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wceq(c0, c1), wceq(cuni(c0), cuni(c1)))
} = {
  3eqtr4g(cuni(c0), cuni(c1), cab(hs0, wrex(hs1, c0, wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)))), cab(hs0, wrex(hs1, c1, wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)))), wceq(c0, c1))
  abbidv(hs0, wceq(c0, c1), wrex(hs1, c0, wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))), wrex(hs1, c1, wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))))
  rexeq(hs1, c0, c1, wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)))
  dfuni2(hs0, hs1, c0)
  dfuni2(hs0, hs1, c1)
  diff.hs0.w(wceq(c0, c1))
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm unieq(class c0, class c1) {
  ‚ä¢ (c0 = c1 ‚Üí ‚ãÉ c0 = ‚ãÉ c1)
} = {
  3eqtr4g(‚ãÉ c0, ‚ãÉ c1, { hs0 | ‚àÉ(hs1 ‚àà c0, hs0 ‚àà hs1)}, { hs0 | ‚àÉ(hs1 ‚àà c1, hs0 ‚àà hs1)}, c0 = c1)
  abbidv(hs0, c0 = c1, ‚àÉ(hs1 ‚àà c0, hs0 ‚àà hs1), ‚àÉ(hs1 ‚àà c1, hs0 ‚àà hs1))
  rexeq(hs1, c0, c1, hs0 ‚àà hs1)
  dfuni2(hs0, hs1, c0)
  dfuni2(hs0, hs1, c1)
  diff.hs0.w(c0 = c1)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
}

blocks.name: unipr
blocks.content: The union of a pair is the union of its members. Proposition 5.7 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 16. (Contributed by NM, 23-Aug-1993.)
blocks.origin:
thm unipr(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wceq(cuni(cpr(c0, c1)), cun(c0, c1))
  -| wcel(c0, universe)
  -| wcel(c1, universe)
} = {
  3eqtr4ri(cuni(cpr(c0, c1)), cun(c0, c1), cab(hs0, wo(wcel(cv(hs0), c0), wcel(cv(hs0), c1))), cab(hs0, wex(hs1, wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wcel(cv(hs1), cpr(c0, c1))))))
  abbii(hs0, wo(wcel(cv(hs0), c0), wcel(cv(hs0), c1)), wex(hs1, wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wcel(cv(hs1), cpr(c0, c1)))))

blocks.name: uni0c
blocks.content: The union of a set is empty iff all of its members are empty. (Contributed by NM, 16-Aug-2006.)

blocks.name: uni0
blocks.content: The union of the empty set is the empty set. Theorem 8.7 of [Quine] p. 54. (Reproved without relying on ~ ax-nul by Eric Schmidt.) (Contributed by NM, 16-Sep-1993.) (Revised by Eric Schmidt, 4-Apr-2007.)

  ssid(c0)
  elrab3(s0, c0, c1, s0 ‚äÜ c0, c0 ‚äÜ c0)
  sseq1(s0, c0, c0)
  rgen(hs0, { s0 ‚àà c1 | s0 ‚äÜ c0 }, hs0 ‚äÜ c0)
  simprbi(hs0 ‚àà { s0 ‚àà c1 | s0 ‚äÜ c0 }, hs0 ‚äÜ c0, hs0 ‚àà c1)
  elrab(s0, hs0, c1, s0 ‚äÜ c0, hs0 ‚äÜ c0)
  sseq1(s0, hs0, c0)
  eqcomd(‚ãÉ { s0 ‚àà c1 | s0 ‚äÜ c0 }, c0, (c0 ‚àà { s0 ‚àà c1 | s0 ‚äÜ c0 } ‚àß ‚àÄ(hs0 ‚àà { s0 ‚àà c1 | s0 ‚äÜ c0 }, hs0 ‚äÜ c0)))
  ssunieq(hs0, c0, { s0 ‚àà c1 | s0 ‚äÜ c0 })
  diff.wss.s(s0, c0, c0)
  diff.wss.s(s0, hs0, c0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c({ s0 ‚àà c1 | s0 ‚äÜ c0 })
}

blocks.name: pwuni
blocks.content: A class is a subclass of the power class of its union. Exercise 6(b) of [Enderton] p. 38. (Contributed by NM, 14-Oct-1996.)
